snippet: Fund-raisers are focusing on a group of 500 to 700 donors in both parties who appear to have maxed out their contributions or come close to a cap struck down by the Supreme Court.
abstract: Fund-raisers for both political parties have wasted no time in the wake of Supreme Court decision freeing donors to spend more on campaigns, asking them for tens of thousands of dollars' worth of additional contributions; decision could inject millions of additional dollars into the 2014 midterm race, but party leaders also fear that some donors will grow weary of writing checks under new rules.
lead_paragraph: Fund-raisers are focusing on a group of 500 to 700 donors in both parties who appear to have maxed out their contributions or come close to a cap struck down by the Supreme Court.

headline.main: Ruling Spurs Rush for Cash in Both Parties
headline.print_headline: Ruling Spurs Rush for Cash in Both Parties

keywords.value: McCutcheon v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
